00035 /********* Coding conventions: ********/
00036 /* Since this is the first file to be included (except 'config.h'),
00037  * I give here some coding conventions used in the rest of the code: 
00038  * - upper case words are usually reserved to constants or macros 
00039  *   (defined by the C preprocessor)
00040  * - 'p_' usually means "pointer to"

00042 /***** End of coding conventions. *****/

00097 /* Definition of M_PI and M_PI_2: */
00098 #ifndef __STRICT_ANSI__ 
00099 /* In <math.h> M_PI is defined as: 3.14159265358979323846 
00100  (M_PI_2 is also defined there). */
00101 #else /* #ifndef __STRICT_ANSI__ */
00102 /* "-ansi" prevents the definition of M_PI in <math.h> */
00103 # define M_PI           3.14159265358979323846  /* pi */
00104 # define M_PI_2         1.57079632679489661923  /* pi/2 */
00105 #endif /* #ifndef __STRICT_ANSI__ */
00106 
00107 #define EPSILON (double) 0.00000000000000000001 /* 10^(-20): should be changed if we use "long double" ... */
00108 
00109 /* This is for double floating point numbers.
00110    The "low precision" is for the positions and values of the bodies,
00111    whereas the high precision is for their force vector and their potential
00112    (the highest precision allowed by a "double" is about 13 digits). */
00113 #define LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF "%.8f"
00114 #define HIGH_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FPRINTF "%.15f"
00115 
00116 /* "DOUBLE" is not meaningful here ... it means rather 'real'. */
00117 #ifdef _SINGLE_PREC_
00118 #define NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF "%f"
00119 #define NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X2 "%f\t%f\n"
00120 #define NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X3 "%f\t%f\t%f\n"
00121 #define NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X4 "%f\t%f\t%f\t%f\n"
00122 #define LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF "%.8f"
00123 #define HIGH_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF "%.15f"
00124 #define NB_BYTES__FOR__NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X3 60 /* same as for double ...  */ 
00125 #define NB_BYTES__FOR__NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X4 60 /* same as for double ...  */
00126 #else /* #ifdef _SINGLE_PREC_ */
00127 #define NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF "%lf"
00128 #define NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X2 "%lf\t%lf\n"
00129 #define NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X3 "%lf\t%lf\t%lf\n"
00130 #define NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X4 "%lf\t%lf\t%lf\t%lf\n"
00131 #define NB_BYTES__FOR__NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X3 60 /* for safety  */ 
00132 #define NB_BYTES__FOR__NO_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF_X4 60 /* we can have for example: 
00133                                                          * "-3.704740e-01\t-1.311980e-01\t3.433600e-01\t1.000000e-06\n\0"  */
00134 
00135 
00136 #define LOW_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF "%.8lf"
00137 #define HIGH_PRECISION_DOUBLE_FSCANF "%.15lf"
00138 #endif /* #ifdef _SINGLE_PREC_ */

00152 /*** sqrtf slower than sqrt on Power5,
00153  * and as fast as sqrt on x86, so sqrt is
00154  * always used (and same for other functions). */
00155 /* #ifdef _SINGLE_PREC_ */
00156 /* #define FMB_COS(x)       cosf(x) */
00157 /* #define FMB_ACOS(x)      acosf(x) */
00158 /* #define FMB_SIN(x)       sinf(x) */
00159 /* #define FMB_ATAN2(x, y)  atan2f(x, y) */
00160 /* #define FMB_FABS(x)      fabsf(x) */
00161 /* #define FMB_FMOD(x, y)   fmodf(x, y) */
00162 /* #define FMB_POW(x, y)    powf(x, y) */
00163 /* #define FMB_LOG(x)       logf(x) */
00164 /* #define FMB_LOG2(x)      log2f(x) */
00165 /* #define FMB_SQRT(x)      sqrtf(x) */
00166 /* #define FMB_FLOOR(x)     floorf(x) */
00167 /* #define FMB_CEIL(x)      ceilf(x) */
00168 /* #else  /\* #ifdef _SINGLE_PREC_ *\/ */
00169 #define FMB_COS(x)       cos(x)
00170 #define FMB_ACOS(x)      acos(x)
00171 #define FMB_SIN(x)       sin(x)
00172 #define FMB_ATAN2(x, y)  atan2(x, y)
00173 #define FMB_FABS(x)      fabs(x)
00174 #define FMB_FMOD(x, y)   fmod(x, y)
00175 #define FMB_POW(x, y)    pow(x, y)
00176 #define FMB_LOG(x)       log(x)
00177 #define FMB_LOG2(x)      log2(x)
00178 #define FMB_SQRT(x)      sqrt(x)
00179 #define FMB_FLOOR(x)     floor(x)
00180 #define FMB_CEIL(x)      ceil(x)
00181 /* #endif /\* #ifdef _SINGLE_PREC_ *\/ */

00203 /*** For "htonl/ntohl": ***/
00204 #ifdef __LINUX__ 
00205 /* Depending on the system, we have to include <arpa/inet.h> or <netinet/in.h>. */
00206 #include <arpa/inet.h> 
00207 #include <netinet/in.h> 
00208 #include <stdint.h> /* for 'uint64_t' */
00209 /* From: http://www.codeproject.com/cpp/endianness.asp */
00210 /* #define ntohll(x) (((uint64_t)(ntohl((int)((x << 32) >> 32))) << 32) | (unsigned int)ntohl(((int)(x >> 32)))) */
00211 /* #define htonll(x) ntohll(x) */
00212 /* #define ntohll(x) (x) */
00213 /* #define htonll(x) (x) */
00214 
00215 
00216 
00217 #endif /* __LINUX__ */
00218 #ifdef __AIX__
00219 #include <sys/types.h>
00220 #include <netinet/in.h>
00221 /* 'uint64_t', 'htonll' and 'ntohll' already defined. */
00222 #endif /* __AIX__ */
